notes: I do not understand how to use Github, and it took time to submit Pick and Place Project. Because I cannot do this work by the deadline due to work, please let me submit at this time.
general_comment:
Hi! 

You wrote in your note that you don't understand how to use Github - Well we have good news for you! 

Udacity has a free course titled "How to Use Git and GitHub".

You can find it here:
https://www.udacity.com/course/how-to-use-git-and-github--ud775

rubric.description:
GitHub Profiles are a key piece of "evidence" to an employer that someone is a good job candidate, because they can see the details of the person's work. This is especially important for entry-level candidates, but also important to those with more experience, because it shows that person is still passionate about coding and has worked recently with new trends in development.

GitHub Profiles are a key piece of "evidence" to an employer that you'd be a good job candidate, because they can see the details of your work. Recruiters use GitHub as a way to find job candidates, and many Nanodegree alumni have received work opportunities from their activity on GitHub. In addition, using GitHub is a way for you to collaborate on projects with other programmers - this will show that you are able to work well with others on an engineering team on the job.

## Submission Instructions
1. Submit this project after you've done some continuous coding for two weeks, so the reviewer will be able to comment on trends.
2. Submit your GitHub profile URL as your project.

## Project Resources
1. [Project Rubric](https://review.udacity.com/#!/rubrics/52/view). *Your project will be reviewed by a Udacity Career Reviewer against this rubric.*
2. [Project checklist](https://docs.google.com/document/d/16B84eUx-nyMWzDkA-I91lXv96ljJbvMA6UhpN5frtJ4/pub). *Based on the project rubric, this is a handy checklist on GitHub best practices.*
3. [Career Resource Center](https://career-resource-center.udacity.com/linkedin-github-profiles). *Find additional tips and guides on developing your GitHub Profile.*

## Up Next
Continue developing on GitHub! For project ideas, consider [contributing to open source](https://career-resource-center.udacity.com/contributing-to-open-source).
